comments.body: This is where it's failing, with `KeyError: 'host_key_checking'`
Do we need the same for the other connection plugins?

I don't think so... this appears to be a paramiko bug (or at any rate for our purposes it is paramiko-specific), so we would only have to change other connections if they use paramiko for transport, but implement it directly rather than handing off to paramiko_ssh.

It would be safer (but not required) to change the literal strings that are being compared to msg into u"" strings.  The reason is that while ```in``` will do the correct thing if the literal string is entirely ascii, if we ever use non-ascii in the literal string or we use ```==``` instead of in, the comparison will fail on Python2 (traceback in the first place, always return False in the second case).  Changing it now isn't necessary but it will hopefully remind anyone working on this in the future that they need to be careful of that.
